results.title: Carbon
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville and Anthony Gilkison Associates
results.brief_description: Shows the various forms of carbon and the familiar uses of such substances as diamond, pencil lead and charcoal. Surveys the everyday uses of carbon, both in the house and in industry, and touches on the development of pyrographite and carbon fibres. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Caravan park
results.brief_description: Caravan Park is filmed both from the point of view of a small child and from an observer. A family of three is stranded in a caravan park when their car breaks down on the road home. A stray cat found near the car is taken as a good luck sign by the father and adopted by his son. As the family continues to struggle to make ends meet and get back on the road, the cat continues to be a sign of good luck for the father, until it dies. This is a slow paced narrative and requires careful examination of the characters to understand its purpose.

results.title: Captivated
results.creator_credit: David Squire, Piers Piers Godden and Dangerous to Know
results.brief_description: Written and performed by Rikki Beadle Blair, “Captivated” is a one-man theatre piece that tells the story of Shane, a gay black man imprisoned for murder. The monotony of his daily routine is broken by letters from a “pink” pen pal, a gay Asian man who writes to Shane as an act of charity. Their correspondence charts Shane’s personal journey from self-hatred, which has manifested in a personal history of violence, to agonised self-reflection, and finally a new found gratitude and respect for his unseen friend. Dynamically staged and produced, with a bravura performance of isolation and redemption by Blair, an award-winning actor and writer on British TV.

results.title: Captain James Cook
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
During the years 1768-1770 Captain James Cook sailed around the world in the ‘Endeavour’ and claimed Australia for the British Crown. This is an account of his voyage. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Captain Huff and Harry: problem solving - consumer mathematics
results.creator_credit: Aesop Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: To fix her broken ship Captain Huff must buy new rivets and a rudder. At the store she uses a calculator to make unit price comparisons, a 10% discount, sales tax and delivery charges. An animated film. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Caps for sale (K)
results.brief_description: This is a charming tale about a pedlar whose stolen caps mean all kinds of monkey business. Whimsical illustrations and flighty trills of music reflect the storyteller’s words. Based on the book written and illustrated by Esphyr Slobodkina. Narrated by Esphyr Slobodkina.

results.title: Capricornia utopia
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, George Patterson-Noble Bartlett and Robinson-Jones
results.brief_description: A film about Australian industries and manufacture in the Rockhampton region of Queensland. Outlines the social, historical, community and rural life including the Flying Doctor Service, the mining areas and Tooloa. Cast features Eric Oldfield and Sharron Fisher with narration by Don McTaggart.

results.title: Capricious summer = Rozmarne leto [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Jiri Menzel, Jan Libora, Ceskoslovensky Filmexport and Filmove Studio Barrandov
results.brief_description: At a second-rate, turn-of-the-century resort, the pool manager, an ex-mayor, and a priest spend the sleepy summer days swimming, drinking, eating and pontificating on Life in a flowery language — until an aerialist/magician and his beautiful “assistant” come to town. Each of the trio in turn becomes humiliatingly convinced that it is too late for an adventure. Based on a novel by the Czech writer Vladimir Vancura, ‘Capricious Summer’ displays the subtle atmosphere of a Jean Renoir film. A film of the Czech New Wave—an highly fertile period in Czech film history that was brutally repressed by the Soviet invasion in 1968. Cast includes Rudolf Hrusinsky, Vlastimil Brodsky, Frantisek Rehak, Mila Myslikova and Jiri Menzel as the aerialist/magician. (Award: Grand Prix, Karlovy Vary Film Festival)

results.title: Capital flight and hyperinflation
results.creator_credit: Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Craig Saunders, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Global Economy”.
This episode of the Open Learning Economics course continues to examine the dynamics of currency exchange on international financial markets. Inflation and interest rates play a pivotal role in determining the strength or weakness of a national currency on the global market. An increase in the inflation rate within a country can precipitate a crisis in which national currency is converted into other currencies for investment and therefore leaves the country. The program examines two specific examples of “capital flight”: the 1982 Currency crisis in Mexico when the Mexican government announced that it could not afford to pay interest on its foreign debt; and the 1989 inflation disaster in Argentina when inflation rates rose to such an uncontrollable extent (up to 200% a month) that the economy collapsed and the peso became valueless. A panel of economists analyse how finanical policy in regard to inflation, interest rates and currency exchange can lead to such economic failure.
